availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: J. E. Vickery (Wayne County, KY, farmer and deputy sheriff)

body.p: Wayne County, Kentucky, laborer, farmer, and deputy sheriff. Married to Mary Vickery. Father of George F. Vickery, William F. Vickery, Thomas H. Vickery, Margaret A. Vickery, and Daniel W Vickery. Laborer in Wayne County in 1850. Farmer in Wayne County in 1860. Deputy sheriff in Wayne County in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, Division 1, p. 313A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, p. 502.
Augusta Phillips Johnson, A Century of Wayne County, Kentucky, 1800-1900 (Louisville: The Standard Printing Co., 1939), 94.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Wayne County Administration Bonds, Vol 3-4, 1884-1908 (Accessed through ancestry.com on March 11, 2020), p. 264 of microfilm.
